variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pytest-runner
dependencies.description: Invoke py.test as distutils command with dependency resolution.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: py-httpx
dependent_to.description:
HTTPX is a fully featured HTTP client for Python 3, which provides sync
and async APIs, and support for both HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2.

dependent_to.name: py-ww
dependent_to.description: Wrappers for Python builtins with higher-level APIs.

dependent_to.name: cvise
dependent_to.description:
C-Vise is a super-parallel Python port of the C-Reduce. The port is
fully compatible to the C-Reduce and uses the same efficient LLVM-based
C/C++ reduction tool named clang_delta.

dependent_to.name: py-setuptools-cpp
dependent_to.description: Simplified packaging for pybind11-based C++ extensions

dependent_to.name: py-beancount
dependent_to.description:
A double-entry bookkeeping computer language that lets you define
financial transaction records in a text file, read them in memory,
generate a variety of reports from them, and provides a web interface..

dependent_to.name: py-trimesh
dependent_to.description: Import, export, process, analyze and view triangular meshes

dependent_to.name: py-binaryornot
dependent_to.description:
Ultra-lightweight pure Python package to check if a file is binary or
text.

dependent_to.name: py-sierrapy
dependent_to.description: A Client of HIVdb Sierra GraphQL Webservice

dependent_to.name: nsimd
dependent_to.description:
NSIMD is a vectorization library that abstracts SIMD programming. It was
designed to exploit the maximum power of processors at a low development
cost.

dependent_to.name: py-sanic
dependent_to.description:
Sanic is a Flask-like Python 3.5+ web server that is written to go fast.
It is based on the work done by the amazing folks at magicstack

dependent_to.name: py-datalad
dependent_to.description:
data distribution geared toward scientific datasets. DataLad makes data
management and data distribution more accessible. To do that, it stands
on the shoulders of Git and Git-annex to deliver a decentralized system
for data exchange. This includes automated ingestion of data from online
portals and exposing it in readily usable form as Git(-annex)
repositories, so-called datasets. The actual data storage and permission
management, however, remains with the original data providers.

dependent_to.name: py-aiohttp
dependent_to.description:
Supports both client and server side of HTTP protocol. Supports both
client and server Web-Sockets out-of-the-box and avoids Callbacks.
Provides Web-server with middlewares and plugable routing.
